title: The Daily Anna- Chapter 4
body:
Master Post 

Anna stood in her living room staring at all the clothes that she had lined up and ready to pack into her suitcase. Packing had never been her strong point. It’s one of the main reasons she’d avoided travel for so long. The furthest she’d ever traveled was Brighton and she’d never been on a plane. She didn’t know what she needed to take with her to go on tour with one of the world’s biggest pop stars. Would she need fancy outfits? Lounge wear? Casual outfits? She had no idea what she would be spending most of her time doing, or if she would be able to do laundry. One of everything is what she decided to go with, something for every occasion and enough underwear for the whole trip so that if she wasn’t able to do laundry, she wouldn’t have to run out to the store for clean pants. She sighed deeply worried that she wouldn’t have what she needed but started packing it all into her bag anyway.

Half an hour later her suitcase was so full it wouldn’t close and she slumped down onto her couch and regretted leaving the packing so late. Her flight left tomorrow morning at 7am and she hadn’t even thought about packing her toiletries yet.

This is usually the point where she would have given in and called Ronnie for help but things had been weird since Anna agreed to going away with Harry. They’d barely spoken, aside from the occasional text that let them know the other was still alive, they didn’t hang out, they didn’t keep each other updated on their lives, Anna didn’t know where she stood with him now and that hurt. This had never happened before, the longest they’d gone without speaking was probably 4 days a few years ago when Ronnie went on holidays and had no phone service. As hard as she tried not to let it get to her, he didn’t really know how to exist without him in her life, but she knew exactly what his problem was and that was what was bothering her the most.

***

The alarm sounded in Anna’s ear at 3:12am exactly and in that moment, she couldn’t think of one logical reason to get out of bed. What was the point in getting a first class flight if she still had to be awake at this ungodly hour? Of course she was grateful that Harry had bought her ticket and arranged everything and she wanted to kick herself for being so bratty but it was early and she couldn’t help it. She rolled over and switched off the blaring alarm which continued to ring in her ears as she took her covers off and adjusted to the morning air.

Much to her surprise, she had managed to get most of her packing done last night, all she had to do now was get dressed, schedule her blog post, pack her laptop , clean her teeth, pack her toothbrush, braid her hair and be out the door by 3:40. She checked her phone again. 3:20. She better get a move on.

Anna’s 2018 Travel playlist

Last week I booked a spur of the moment trip to the US and I leave Monday so I thought I’d share with you all the playlist I’ll be listening to on the plane. It’s a trip I’ve always dreamed about doing but between uni and other commitments I never had the time or the money, but now that I’m done with uni and I’ve had a few months to get this professional blogging thing on the go, I thought I might as well and what could be more fun than taking you all along with me? I’ve never done this whole travel blogging thing before so don’t expect daily posts especially while I’m dealing with jetlag. I’m away for about 6 weeks at this stage, but who knows, it could be longer!

Here are the tunes I’ll be blasting while I’m away, I’ve made a Spotify playlist for those of you that have it, check out the link at the end of this post.

  1. Give yourself a try - The 1975
  2. Strawberries and cigarettes - Troye Sivan
  3. Sink In - Amy Shark
  4. Sign of the Times - Harry Styles
  5. Writer In the Dark - Lorde
  6. Rainbow - Kacey Musgraves
  7. Magnolia - Gang of Youths
  8. 1950 - King Princess
  9. Sweet Creature - Harry Styles
  10. Hearts Don’t Break Around Here - Ed Sheeran
  11. little     light - lewis watson
  12. Kiwi - Harry Styles
  13. Still     the One - Shania Twain (Don’t judge, you know you love it as much as I do)    
  14. Olivia - One Direction
  15. Hey Jude - The Beatles
  16. Yellow - Coldplay
  17. Only Angel - Harry Styles
  18. The Chain - Fleetwood Mac
  19. Starman - David Bowie
  20. Woman - Harry Styles

****

“Please remember to set your clocks to 12:33 pm local time” the pilot said his voice echoing through the cabin as the plane touched down on the runway at Dallas airport.  The flight hadn’t been as bad as Anna thought it would have been, and maybe that was because she was in first class and she got to sleep for most of it, or maybe it was because it was an early flight and the airport wasn’t that busy and she didn’t have to stress about the crowds and finding the right places on time. It was all straight forward and she was thankful for that.

“Miss Elliot” One of the flight attendants approched her as everyone was getting ready to get off the plane

“That’s me” Anna replied shyly.

“Mr Styles has arranged to meet you on the runway to avoid a commotion, so when you get off the plane head straight for the security car, all of your luggage has already been taken there”

Anna nodded and thanked her while she continued to pack her things away. She guessed that this was part of the reason she had landed in New York first, so that she didn’t have to go through all the hassle of customs when she could be spending time with Harry. She fixed her hair and makeup quickly and waited for the flight attendants to start ushering people off the plane.

The hot air washed over her as she stepped outside onto the tarmac, she knew it was going to be hot, but this is not what she had expected, the air was dry and the heat hit her like a wave. There was a black range rover sitting on the edge of the tarmac almost right next to the door that would lead the rest of the passengers into the airport. As she made her way over to it it seemed obvious to her that Harry was waiting in there but she wondered if any of the other passengers guessed that someone as famous as him was sitting there or if it looked completely normal to them.

Anna reached the car and wrapped her fingers around the handle to the back door, taking a deep breath as pulled it open.

“Anna!” Harry exclaimed, taking her hand and helping her into the car and kissing it as she sat down “Long time no see.” His smile was wide and Anna couldn’t help but blush.

“It’s only been two weeks” she giggled

“That’s a long time” He nodded his head sarcastically.

“I guess it is” she leant up and kissed his cheek

“How was the flight?” he asked moving slightly so that Anna could do her seatbelt up

“I need a shower and some moisturizer” She laughed.

The car began to pull away from the tarmac

“I figured you would. We’re going straight back to the hotel and we can go exploring later”

“Thank you”

“I uh” Harry shifted in his seat feeling a little nervous “I got you your own room, I wanted you to be comfortable, but you’re more than welcome to stay with me”

Anna was secretly pleased about this. She liked Harry a lot more than she cared to admit, but they’d been on two dates and if they were going to be living in each other’s pockets for the next few months, she was glad she would have her own space when she needed it.

“Thanks” she nodded “I’ll visit a lot”

He smiled and interlocked his fingers with hers “I’d like that”

When they arrived at the hotel, Harry took Anna’s bags from the back of the car and showed her to her room, which was right next door to his. It was bigger than she expected, with it a separate living room and bedroom as well as a small kitchen area,

“Wow” she sighed as she looked around “It’s big”

Harry giggled and Anna glared at him before smile spread across her face “Get your mind out of the gutter”

“Can’t help it love” he smirked, flashing his dimples.

She took her hands and placed them on his chest pushing him backwards towards the door “I need to shower,  I’ll see you later”

“Do I get a kiss first?”

Anna stood staring at him for a moment considering his request and then she stood on her toes and pecked his lips gently.

“I’ll kiss you properly once I’ve cleaned my teeth”

“I appreciate that” he laughed and gentley pecked her forehead before he turned and walked out of the room.

***

Harry was getting ready to go onstage for his first show of the American Tour and while Anna had been spending time with him backstage it was time for her to let him get ready.

“You can stay” he said holding onto her hand as she tried to leave his dressing room.

“You have a show to put on” she giggled and kissed his forehead “I’ll still be here when it’s over”

“Good” he smiled and let go of her hand “stay up the front please”

“Of course” she said as she turned to walk away.

The hallways of the venue were chaotic. There were crew members everywhere, shouting commands to make sure that everything was ready to go. Anna weaved her way through them, being careful not to disturb them as she made her way to the back exit of the venue. Herself and Harry were doing their best to keep things quiet so that his fans didn’t find out before they were ready for them to know. Anna had a ticket to get into the venue the same way the fans did, she didn’t have a treat people with kindness sticker like Harry’s other guests, but the whole crew and the venue security knew who she was. She blended into the crowd as she walked past the merch stand and into the front entrance where she walked quickly to the door on her ticket and into the arena. She couldn’t get close to the front, the fans had lined the barrier and beyond, all excited for Harry to come on stage, so she remained at the back of the pit making sure she didn’t disturb anyone, and hoped that he’d be able to see her anyway. The pre-show playlist was echoing through the room and Anna watched as everyone around her sang along to Olivia by One Direction.

“Anna?” she felt a hand on her shoulder and turned around to see a dark haired woman in her late forties standing behind her.

“Hi,” she smiled, wondering why she had been recognised all the way in Dallas Texas, she was sure her  blog didn’t reach that far, although this woman’s accent didn’t sound American.

“I’m Anne” she held her hand out to shake Anna’s “Harry’s Mum”

“Oh,” Anna said shaking her head and feeling a little stupid she knew that Anne was here but she didn’t know that Anne knew that she was here  “Hi, sorry, I didn’t expect to meet you tonight”

“No sorry love it’s my fault, I shouldn’t have snuck up behind you like that, I just had to meet the girl my son hasn’t shut up about for the last few months”

Anna blushed “He’s a good guy, very gentlemanly, you did a wonderful job raising him”

“He made it easy” she smiled “So I hear you write a blog, what do you write about”

“Whatever comes to mind, I post daily so sometimes I struggle to think of things, but that’s part of the fun” Anna admitted, curious about what Harry had said to her.

“And you met him in London? At his show?”

“Yeah” Anna nodded “My friend, Ronnie, works for the O2 so he took me along and had me ‘help’” she said using air quotes “with photography”

Anne smiled “What are friends for?”

Anna’s heart sank a little, thinking about how much she missed Ronnie. “You must be incredibly proud” Anna gestured around the room at the crowd that was now filling the arena getting more and more excited with the end of each song on the playlist.

“He’s a mother’s dream” Anne nodded.

They stood together for a while, getting to know each other, and Anna appreciated the effort Anne was making to make her feel welcome, but it dawned on her that most of Harry’s fans would recognise Anne and would be curious as to why she was talking to Anna and a handful of them would remember that she was at the London show, and they might put two and two together.

“I’m sorry Anne,” she said sympathetically “Harry and I don’t really know what this whole thing is yet, and we don’t want people getting wind of it, if they see me with you they might work it out”

Anne nodded “I understand love, we’ll catch up backstage.”

The show was about to start, Harry would be standing on the stage by now, waiting for the screens to rise and Anna could feel his nerves for him, but she could also feel a pounding ache in her head and she wished that she hadn’t left her bag backstage. She rubbed her temples and tried to shake it off but the loud opening of Only Angel only made it worse. She looked up at the stage and the lights made her eyes blur and she knew that she was getting a migraine. It had been years since she’d had one, she would have been about 18 the last time and she hoped to god this one wouldn’t be as bad.

Harry could see Anna from where he was standing on stage, and although there was hundreds of people around her, he thought she looked at little pale. He was midway through Stockholm Syndrome but he had to make sure she was ok.

“Stop stop stop” he called to the band and the music ceased. He pulled the mic off it’s stand and walked closer to where Anna was standing.

“Are you ok up the back there?”

The crowd around her screamed which only made her headache worse. She knew he was talking about her, but she thought for the sake of keeping it quiet, she tried to play dumb.

He caught on and followed in her footsteps “You, with the blonde hair and the lovely white blouse, are you alright, you look a bit ill”

People turned around and pointed to her and she gave in. “I’m Ok” she called holding her thumbs up in case he couldn’t hear her

“You good? Need anything? Water maybe?”

She nodded and watched as Harry signalled a security guard that was standing near her and threw one of his water bottles to him.

“Could you give that to her please?”

The water made its way to her and knowing who she was, the security guard stayed by her, making sure she was ok.

Anna stuck it out for a few more songs, but by the time Harry was making his way to the b-stage she couldn’t wait any longer. She told the guard she had to go backstage and she rushed out of the room while Harry couldn’t see. She didn’t know how to get to Harry’s dressing room from inside the venue, so the guard went with her and at this point she didn’t care if people started to work something out, she was sure they would be paying more attention to Harry anyway and she needed to take some ibuprofen.

When she got to the dressing room she found her purse, pulled out her painkillers, and turned the lights out wishing her head would stop pounding.

She must have fallen asleep because the next thing she knew, she  woke up to Harry sitting next to her on the couch with his hand resting gently on her back.

“Anna” he whispered as her eyes blinked open “What’s going on?”

She blinked a few times, adjusting to being awake again “I got a migraine.”

Her voice was soft and barely audible but Harry nodded and began rubbing circles around her back “You didn’t look good out there, is there anything I can do?”

“Cuddle me” she whispered.

Big shout out to @lovesmelikebrandnewstarlight​ for talking through things with me and helping with the editing. She’s an angel. AND she made Anna’s playlist on spotify so if you want to check it out you can find it here 

Let me know what you thought of this chapter or what you think might happen next. I’m also going to write some blurbs and concepts about this series so if you have requests send them through 

Thank you so much for reading, it means the world to me xxxx

“Please remember to set your clocks to 12:33 pm local time” the pilot said his voice echoing through the cabin as the plane touched down on the runway at Dallas airport.  The flight hadn’t been as bad as Anna thought it would have been, and maybe that was because she was in first class and she got to sleep for most of it, or maybe it was because it was an early flight and the airport wasn’t that busy and she didn’t have to stress about the crowds and finding the right places on time. It was all straight forward and she was thankful for that.

“Miss Elliot” One of the flight attendants approched her as everyone was getting ready to get off the plane

“That’s me” Anna replied shyly.

“Mr Styles has arranged to meet you on the runway to avoid a commotion, so when you get off the plane head straight for the security car, all of your luggage has already been taken there”

Anna nodded and thanked her while she continued to pack her things away. She guessed that this was part of the reason she had landed in New York first, so that she didn’t have to go through all the hassle of customs when she could be spending time with Harry. She fixed her hair and makeup quickly and waited for the flight attendants to start ushering people off the plane.

The hot air washed over her as she stepped outside onto the tarmac, she knew it was going to be hot, but this is not what she had expected, the air was dry and the heat hit her like a wave. There was a black range rover sitting on the edge of the tarmac almost right next to the door that would lead the rest of the passengers into the airport. As she made her way over to it it seemed obvious to her that Harry was waiting in there but she wondered if any of the other passengers guessed that someone as famous as him was sitting there or if it looked completely normal to them.

Anna reached the car and wrapped her fingers around the handle to the back door, taking a deep breath as pulled it open.

“Anna!” Harry exclaimed, taking her hand and helping her into the car and kissing it as she sat down “Long time no see.” His smile was wide and Anna couldn’t help but blush.

“It’s only been two weeks” she giggled

“That’s a long time” He nodded his head sarcastically.

“I guess it is” she leant up and kissed his cheek

“How was the flight?” he asked moving slightly so that Anna could do her seatbelt up

“I need a shower and some moisturizer” She laughed.

The car began to pull away from the tarmac

“I figured you would. We’re going straight back to the hotel and we can go exploring later”

“Thank you”

“I uh” Harry shifted in his seat feeling a little nervous “I got you your own room, I wanted you to be comfortable, but you’re more than welcome to stay with me”

Anna was secretly pleased about this. She liked Harry a lot more than she cared to admit, but they’d been on two dates and if they were going to be living in each other’s pockets for the next few months, she was glad she would have her own space when she needed it.

“Thanks” she nodded “I’ll visit a lot”

He smiled and interlocked his fingers with hers “I’d like that”

When they arrived at the hotel, Harry took Anna’s bags from the back of the car and showed her to her room, which was right next door to his. It was bigger than she expected, with it a separate living room and bedroom as well as a small kitchen area,

“Wow” she sighed as she looked around “It’s big”

Harry giggled and Anna glared at him before smile spread across her face “Get your mind out of the gutter”

“Can’t help it love” he smirked, flashing his dimples.

She took her hands and placed them on his chest pushing him backwards towards the door “I need to shower,  I’ll see you later”

“Do I get a kiss first?”

Anna stood staring at him for a moment considering his request and then she stood on her toes and pecked his lips gently.

“I’ll kiss you properly once I’ve cleaned my teeth”

“I appreciate that” he laughed and gentley pecked her forehead before he turned and walked out of the room.

***

Harry was getting ready to go onstage for his first show of the American Tour and while Anna had been spending time with him backstage it was time for her to let him get ready.

“You can stay” he said holding onto her hand as she tried to leave his dressing room.

“You have a show to put on” she giggled and kissed his forehead “I’ll still be here when it’s over”

“Good” he smiled and let go of her hand “stay up the front please”

“Of course” she said as she turned to walk away.

The hallways of the venue were chaotic. There were crew members everywhere, shouting commands to make sure that everything was ready to go. Anna weaved her way through them, being careful not to disturb them as she made her way to the back exit of the venue. Herself and Harry were doing their best to keep things quiet so that his fans didn’t find out before they were ready for them to know. Anna had a ticket to get into the venue the same way the fans did, she didn’t have a treat people with kindness sticker like Harry’s other guests, but the whole crew and the venue security knew who she was. She blended into the crowd as she walked past the merch stand and into the front entrance where she walked quickly to the door on her ticket and into the arena. She couldn’t get close to the front, the fans had lined the barrier and beyond, all excited for Harry to come on stage, so she remained at the back of the pit making sure she didn’t disturb anyone, and hoped that he’d be able to see her anyway. The pre-show playlist was echoing through the room and Anna watched as everyone around her sang along to Olivia by One Direction.

“Anna?” she felt a hand on her shoulder and turned around to see a dark haired woman in her late forties standing behind her.

“Hi,” she smiled, wondering why she had been recognised all the way in Dallas Texas, she was sure her  blog didn’t reach that far, although this woman’s accent didn’t sound American.

“I’m Anne” she held her hand out to shake Anna’s “Harry’s Mum”

“Oh,” Anna said shaking her head and feeling a little stupid she knew that Anne was here but she didn’t know that Anne knew that she was here  “Hi, sorry, I didn’t expect to meet you tonight”

“No sorry love it’s my fault, I shouldn’t have snuck up behind you like that, I just had to meet the girl my son hasn’t shut up about for the last few months”

Anna blushed “He’s a good guy, very gentlemanly, you did a wonderful job raising him”

“He made it easy” she smiled “So I hear you write a blog, what do you write about”

“Whatever comes to mind, I post daily so sometimes I struggle to think of things, but that’s part of the fun” Anna admitted, curious about what Harry had said to her.

“And you met him in London? At his show?”

“Yeah” Anna nodded “My friend, Ronnie, works for the O2 so he took me along and had me ‘help’” she said using air quotes “with photography”

Anne smiled “What are friends for?”

Anna’s heart sank a little, thinking about how much she missed Ronnie. “You must be incredibly proud” Anna gestured around the room at the crowd that was now filling the arena getting more and more excited with the end of each song on the playlist.

“He’s a mother’s dream” Anne nodded.

They stood together for a while, getting to know each other, and Anna appreciated the effort Anne was making to make her feel welcome, but it dawned on her that most of Harry’s fans would recognise Anne and would be curious as to why she was talking to Anna and a handful of them would remember that she was at the London show, and they might put two and two together.

“I’m sorry Anne,” she said sympathetically “Harry and I don’t really know what this whole thing is yet, and we don’t want people getting wind of it, if they see me with you they might work it out”

Anne nodded “I understand love, we’ll catch up backstage.”

The show was about to start, Harry would be standing on the stage by now, waiting for the screens to rise and Anna could feel his nerves for him, but she could also feel a pounding ache in her head and she wished that she hadn’t left her bag backstage. She rubbed her temples and tried to shake it off but the loud opening of Only Angel only made it worse. She looked up at the stage and the lights made her eyes blur and she knew that she was getting a migraine. It had been years since she’d had one, she would have been about 18 the last time and she hoped to god this one wouldn’t be as bad.

Harry could see Anna from where he was standing on stage, and although there was hundreds of people around her, he thought she looked at little pale. He was midway through Stockholm Syndrome but he had to make sure she was ok.

“Stop stop stop” he called to the band and the music ceased. He pulled the mic off it’s stand and walked closer to where Anna was standing.

“Are you ok up the back there?”

The crowd around her screamed which only made her headache worse. She knew he was talking about her, but she thought for the sake of keeping it quiet, she tried to play dumb.

He caught on and followed in her footsteps “You, with the blonde hair and the lovely white blouse, are you alright, you look a bit ill”

People turned around and pointed to her and she gave in. “I’m Ok” she called holding her thumbs up in case he couldn’t hear her

“You good? Need anything? Water maybe?”

She nodded and watched as Harry signalled a security guard that was standing near her and threw one of his water bottles to him.

“Could you give that to her please?”

The water made its way to her and knowing who she was, the security guard stayed by her, making sure she was ok.

Anna stuck it out for a few more songs, but by the time Harry was making his way to the b-stage she couldn’t wait any longer. She told the guard she had to go backstage and she rushed out of the room while Harry couldn’t see. She didn’t know how to get to Harry’s dressing room from inside the venue, so the guard went with her and at this point she didn’t care if people started to work something out, she was sure they would be paying more attention to Harry anyway and she needed to take some ibuprofen.

When she got to the dressing room she found her purse, pulled out her painkillers, and turned the lights out wishing her head would stop pounding.

She must have fallen asleep because the next thing she knew, she  woke up to Harry sitting next to her on the couch with his hand resting gently on her back.

“Anna” he whispered as her eyes blinked open “What’s going on?”

She blinked a few times, adjusting to being awake again “I got a migraine.”

Her voice was soft and barely audible but Harry nodded and began rubbing circles around her back “You didn’t look good out there, is there anything I can do?”

“Cuddle me” she whispered.

Thank you so much for reading, it means the world to me xxxx

“Mr Styles has arranged to meet you on the runway to avoid a commotion, so when you get off the plane head straight for the security car, all of your luggage has already been taken there”

Anna nodded and thanked her while she continued to pack her things away. She guessed that this was part of the reason she had landed in New York first, so that she didn’t have to go through all the hassle of customs when she could be spending time with Harry. She fixed her hair and makeup quickly and waited for the flight attendants to start ushering people off the plane.

The hot air washed over her as she stepped outside onto the tarmac, she knew it was going to be hot, but this is not what she had expected, the air was dry and the heat hit her like a wave. There was a black range rover sitting on the edge of the tarmac almost right next to the door that would lead the rest of the passengers into the airport. As she made her way over to it it seemed obvious to her that Harry was waiting in there but she wondered if any of the other passengers guessed that someone as famous as him was sitting there or if it looked completely normal to them.

Anna reached the car and wrapped her fingers around the handle to the back door, taking a deep breath as pulled it open.

“Anna!” Harry exclaimed, taking her hand and helping her into the car and kissing it as she sat down “Long time no see.” His smile was wide and Anna couldn’t help but blush.

“It’s only been two weeks” she giggled

“That’s a long time” He nodded his head sarcastically.

“I guess it is” she leant up and kissed his cheek

“How was the flight?” he asked moving slightly so that Anna could do her seatbelt up

“I need a shower and some moisturizer” She laughed.

The car began to pull away from the tarmac

“I figured you would. We’re going straight back to the hotel and we can go exploring later”

“Thank you”

“I uh” Harry shifted in his seat feeling a little nervous “I got you your own room, I wanted you to be comfortable, but you’re more than welcome to stay with me”

Anna was secretly pleased about this. She liked Harry a lot more than she cared to admit, but they’d been on two dates and if they were going to be living in each other’s pockets for the next few months, she was glad she would have her own space when she needed it.

“Thanks” she nodded “I’ll visit a lot”

He smiled and interlocked his fingers with hers “I’d like that”

When they arrived at the hotel, Harry took Anna’s bags from the back of the car and showed her to her room, which was right next door to his. It was bigger than she expected, with it a separate living room and bedroom as well as a small kitchen area,

“Wow” she sighed as she looked around “It’s big”

Harry giggled and Anna glared at him before smile spread across her face “Get your mind out of the gutter”

“Can’t help it love” he smirked, flashing his dimples.

She took her hands and placed them on his chest pushing him backwards towards the door “I need to shower,  I’ll see you later”

“Do I get a kiss first?”

Anna stood staring at him for a moment considering his request and then she stood on her toes and pecked his lips gently.

“I’ll kiss you properly once I’ve cleaned my teeth”

“I appreciate that” he laughed and gentley pecked her forehead before he turned and walked out of the room.

***

Harry was getting ready to go onstage for his first show of the American Tour and while Anna had been spending time with him backstage it was time for her to let him get ready.

“You can stay” he said holding onto her hand as she tried to leave his dressing room.

“You have a show to put on” she giggled and kissed his forehead “I’ll still be here when it’s over”

“Good” he smiled and let go of her hand “stay up the front please”

“Of course” she said as she turned to walk away.

The hallways of the venue were chaotic. There were crew members everywhere, shouting commands to make sure that everything was ready to go. Anna weaved her way through them, being careful not to disturb them as she made her way to the back exit of the venue. Herself and Harry were doing their best to keep things quiet so that his fans didn’t find out before they were ready for them to know. Anna had a ticket to get into the venue the same way the fans did, she didn’t have a treat people with kindness sticker like Harry’s other guests, but the whole crew and the venue security knew who she was. She blended into the crowd as she walked past the merch stand and into the front entrance where she walked quickly to the door on her ticket and into the arena. She couldn’t get close to the front, the fans had lined the barrier and beyond, all excited for Harry to come on stage, so she remained at the back of the pit making sure she didn’t disturb anyone, and hoped that he’d be able to see her anyway. The pre-show playlist was echoing through the room and Anna watched as everyone around her sang along to Olivia by One Direction.

“Anna?” she felt a hand on her shoulder and turned around to see a dark haired woman in her late forties standing behind her.

“Hi,” she smiled, wondering why she had been recognised all the way in Dallas Texas, she was sure her  blog didn’t reach that far, although this woman’s accent didn’t sound American.

“I’m Anne” she held her hand out to shake Anna’s “Harry’s Mum”

“Oh,” Anna said shaking her head and feeling a little stupid she knew that Anne was here but she didn’t know that Anne knew that she was here  “Hi, sorry, I didn’t expect to meet you tonight”

“No sorry love it’s my fault, I shouldn’t have snuck up behind you like that, I just had to meet the girl my son hasn’t shut up about for the last few months”

Anna blushed “He’s a good guy, very gentlemanly, you did a wonderful job raising him”

“He made it easy” she smiled “So I hear you write a blog, what do you write about”

“Whatever comes to mind, I post daily so sometimes I struggle to think of things, but that’s part of the fun” Anna admitted, curious about what Harry had said to her.

“And you met him in London? At his show?”

“Yeah” Anna nodded “My friend, Ronnie, works for the O2 so he took me along and had me ‘help’” she said using air quotes “with photography”

Anne smiled “What are friends for?”

Anna’s heart sank a little, thinking about how much she missed Ronnie. “You must be incredibly proud” Anna gestured around the room at the crowd that was now filling the arena getting more and more excited with the end of each song on the playlist.

“He’s a mother’s dream” Anne nodded.

They stood together for a while, getting to know each other, and Anna appreciated the effort Anne was making to make her feel welcome, but it dawned on her that most of Harry’s fans would recognise Anne and would be curious as to why she was talking to Anna and a handful of them would remember that she was at the London show, and they might put two and two together.

“I’m sorry Anne,” she said sympathetically “Harry and I don’t really know what this whole thing is yet, and we don’t want people getting wind of it, if they see me with you they might work it out”

Anne nodded “I understand love, we’ll catch up backstage.”

The show was about to start, Harry would be standing on the stage by now, waiting for the screens to rise and Anna could feel his nerves for him, but she could also feel a pounding ache in her head and she wished that she hadn’t left her bag backstage. She rubbed her temples and tried to shake it off but the loud opening of Only Angel only made it worse. She looked up at the stage and the lights made her eyes blur and she knew that she was getting a migraine. It had been years since she’d had one, she would have been about 18 the last time and she hoped to god this one wouldn’t be as bad.

Harry could see Anna from where he was standing on stage, and although there was hundreds of people around her, he thought she looked at little pale. He was midway through Stockholm Syndrome but he had to make sure she was ok.

“Stop stop stop” he called to the band and the music ceased. He pulled the mic off it’s stand and walked closer to where Anna was standing.

“Are you ok up the back there?”

The crowd around her screamed which only made her headache worse. She knew he was talking about her, but she thought for the sake of keeping it quiet, she tried to play dumb.

He caught on and followed in her footsteps “You, with the blonde hair and the lovely white blouse, are you alright, you look a bit ill”

People turned around and pointed to her and she gave in. “I’m Ok” she called holding her thumbs up in case he couldn’t hear her

“You good? Need anything? Water maybe?”

She nodded and watched as Harry signalled a security guard that was standing near her and threw one of his water bottles to him.

“Could you give that to her please?”

The water made its way to her and knowing who she was, the security guard stayed by her, making sure she was ok.

Anna stuck it out for a few more songs, but by the time Harry was making his way to the b-stage she couldn’t wait any longer. She told the guard she had to go backstage and she rushed out of the room while Harry couldn’t see. She didn’t know how to get to Harry’s dressing room from inside the venue, so the guard went with her and at this point she didn’t care if people started to work something out, she was sure they would be paying more attention to Harry anyway and she needed to take some ibuprofen.

When she got to the dressing room she found her purse, pulled out her painkillers, and turned the lights out wishing her head would stop pounding.

She must have fallen asleep because the next thing she knew, she  woke up to Harry sitting next to her on the couch with his hand resting gently on her back.

“Anna” he whispered as her eyes blinked open “What’s going on?”

She blinked a few times, adjusting to being awake again “I got a migraine.”

Her voice was soft and barely audible but Harry nodded and began rubbing circles around her back “You didn’t look good out there, is there anything I can do?”

“Cuddle me” she whispered.

Big shout out to @lovesmelikebrandnewstarlight​ for talking through things with me and helping with the editing. She’s an angel. AND she made Anna’s playlist on spotify so if you want to check it out you can find it here 

Let me know what you thought of this chapter or what you think might happen next. I’m also going to write some blurbs and concepts about this series so if you have requests send them through 

Thank you so much for reading, it means the world to me xxxx
trail.content_abstract:
Master Post 

Anna stood in her living room staring at all the clothes that she had lined up and ready to pack into her suitcase. Packing had never been her strong point. It’s one of the main reasons she’d avoided travel for so long. The furthest she’d ever traveled was Brighton and she’d never been on a plane. She didn’t know what she needed to take with her to go on tour with one of the world’s biggest pop stars. Would she need fancy outfits? Lounge wear? Casual outfits? She had no idea what she would be spending most of her time doing, or if she would be able to do laundry. One of everything is what she decided to go with, something for every occasion and enough underwear for the whole trip so that if she wasn’t able to do laundry, she wouldn’t have to run out to the store for clean pants. She sighed deeply worried that she wouldn’t have what she needed but started packing it all into her bag anyway.

Half an hour later her suitcase was so full it wouldn’t close and she slumped down onto her couch and regretted leaving the packing so late. Her flight left tomorrow morning at 7am and she hadn’t even thought about packing her toiletries yet.

This is usually the point where she would have given in and called Ronnie for help but things had been weird since Anna agreed to going away with Harry. They’d barely spoken, aside from the occasional text that let them know the other was still alive, they didn’t hang out, they didn’t keep each other updated on their lives, Anna didn’t know where she stood with him now and that hurt. This had never happened before, the longest they’d gone without speaking was probably 4 days a few years ago when Ronnie went on holidays and had no phone service. As hard as she tried not to let it get to her, he didn’t really know how to exist without him in her life, but she knew exactly what his problem was and that was what was bothering her the most.

***

The alarm sounded in Anna’s ear at 3:12am exactly and in that moment, she couldn’t think of one logical reason to get out of bed. What was the point in getting a first class flight if she still had to be awake at this ungodly hour? Of course she was grateful that Harry had bought her ticket and arranged everything and she wanted to kick herself for being so bratty but it was early and she couldn’t help it. She rolled over and switched off the blaring alarm which continued to ring in her ears as she took her covers off and adjusted to the morning air.

Much to her surprise, she had managed to get most of her packing done last night, all she had to do now was get dressed, schedule her blog post, pack her laptop , clean her teeth, pack her toothbrush, braid her hair and be out the door by 3:40. She checked her phone again. 3:20. She better get a move on.

Anna’s 2018 Travel playlist

Last week I booked a spur of the moment trip to the US and I leave Monday so I thought I’d share with you all the playlist I’ll be listening to on the plane. It’s a trip I’ve always dreamed about doing but between uni and other commitments I never had the time or the money, but now that I’m done with uni and I’ve had a few months to get this professional blogging thing on the go, I thought I might as well and what could be more fun than taking you all along with me? I’ve never done this whole travel blogging thing before so don’t expect daily posts especially while I’m dealing with jetlag. I’m away for about 6 weeks at this stage, but who knows, it could be longer!

Here are the tunes I’ll be blasting while I’m away, I’ve made a Spotify playlist for those of you that have it, check out the link at the end of this post.

  1. Give yourself a try - The 1975
  2. Strawberries and cigarettes - Troye Sivan
  3. Sink In - Amy Shark
  4. Sign of the Times - Harry Styles
  5. Writer In the Dark - Lorde
  6. Rainbow - Kacey Musgraves
  7. Magnolia - Gang of Youths
  8. 1950 - King Princess
  9. Sweet Creature - Harry Styles
  10. Hearts Don’t Break Around Here - Ed Sheeran
  11. little     light - lewis watson
  12. Kiwi - Harry Styles
  13. Still     the One - Shania Twain (Don’t judge, you know you love it as much as I do)    
  14. Olivia - One Direction
  15. Hey Jude - The Beatles
  16. Yellow - Coldplay
  17. Only Angel - Harry Styles
  18. The Chain - Fleetwood Mac
  19. Starman - David Bowie
  20. Woman - Harry Styles

****

blog.title: Former Harrie Club
blog.description:
I created this as a place for former Harry fans who have recently been turned off by his promotion and solo rollout and are now just confused and want to have open discourse about it. I accept submitted posts and will post anything that is not derogatory or rude. Please keep it civil, we are here to talk not belittle each other. Attackers will be blocked.NEW: I will now be cutting off or removing submissions that are just repeating discussions that have already taken place. Please read back if you have a question, chances are it's been answered. As an added note, we are aware that not all Harries are angry people but we sometimes generalize due to character limits, apologies in advance but we know there are many lovely, kind, friendly Harries out there and we don't mean to offend you. <!-- Start of StatCounter Code for Tumblr -->

summary: Honestly anon, H having a blm flag or sticker on his guitar means hardly anything to me. Until he says anything other than vague...
body:
Honestly anon, H having a blm flag or sticker on his guitar means hardly anything to me. Until he says anything other than vague blanket statements I really don’t care. It’s the same as t-shirt activism and doesn’t do anything to help if he’s not also discussing it in some way. And I’m saying all of this w/o all of his previous bs regarding blm. Also idk how emphasizing blm during sott is a positive considering the song says ‘stop you’re crying’ and ‘we’ve got to get away’ lmao how that song even remotely relates to blm or could be seen as a positive relation is beyond me. What a lot of us feel about H is directly linked to what he has or hasn’t done. We’re not out here calling him racist. No one here is making up tales or insinuating what he believes, we can only go by his actions which is what we have done. Feel free to think he is some kind of brave activist, that’s your right. If we feel like he’s only doing this to appease ppl and look good then that’s our right. If any of his black fans find meaning in him holding up the flags that’s great, and I’m glad they find comfort in that but that doesn’t mean that I have to feel that way. We’re at a place now that holding up a flag isn’t really cutting it, we need actual action and influence. You may see him as supporting blm. I see him doing the bare minimum to not lose/upset fans. I also see him covering a song by an artist that said she would’ve voted for Trump if she could have so 🤷🏾‍♀️

***

👆🏻👆🏻👆🏻🛎🛎🛎

SOTT is the least inspirational song ever.

We’re at a place now that holding up a flag isn’t really cutting it, we need actual action and influence. You may see him as supporting blm. I see him doing the bare minimum to not lose/upset fans. I also see him covering a song by an artist that said she would’ve voted for Trump if she could have so 🤷🏾‍♀️

***

👆🏻👆🏻👆🏻🛎🛎🛎

SOTT is the least inspirational song ever.
